title: Fabien Galthié - Wikipedia
snippet: Fabien Galthié (French pronunciation: [fabjɛ̃ ɡaltie]; born 20 March 1969) is a French rugby union coach and former player, currently the head coach of the France national team.

title: France national rugby union team - Wikipedia
snippet: After the 2023 Rugby World Cup, Ghezal, Labit and Giroud left the France coaching staff and were replaced respectively by Stade Français forwards coach Laurent Sempéré, former international centre Patrick Arlettaz and Nicolas Jeanjean, who became the head of high performance.

title: France rugby union team: Fixtures, squad and head coach
snippet: A distinguished former player himself, receiving 64 international caps for Les Bleus as a scrum-half between 1991 and 2003, Fabien Galthie became France head coach in 2019. Galthie led France to the Six Nations Grand Slam in 2022 with his coaching philosophy for the team revolving around an ...

title: Shaun Edwards OBE
snippet: Antoine Dupont Captain, France National Rugby Team · Shaun Edwards is currently the Defence Coach for the French National Rugby union team. Shaun joined L’equipe de France in 2019 and they went on to win a Grand Slam in 2022.

title: France national rugby union team coaches - FamousFix.com list
snippet: Overview: Fabien Galthié (born 20 March 1969) is a French rugby union coach and former player, he is currently the head coach of the French national team. His usual position was at scrum-half.
